text.title: Musa Jocosa de Vários Entremezes Portugueses e Castelhanos
text.author: Nuno Nisceno Sutil

w.comment: "Crítico presumido e mordaz" (from Zoilus, a Greek grammarian and Synic philosopher).
Here the speaker uses the 3rd person to refer to himself.
"Nada; mais" in the original. We understand "(Para) nada mais que...".
We have decided to exclude the verse repeating "fora o seu desejo tanto", which may have been included intentionally, in the original.
The compiler of a series of fragments of greek authors, born in the city of Stobi, in Macedonia.
Italics included in this excerpt to mark direct speech.
In the original: "Disse fiando: na roca".
Italics included to mark direct speech.
Italics included to mark direct speech.
In the original: "Quem nos perdoar as faltas: também silêncio me otorga".
From this sentence onwards, the text shows the abbreviation "Ent." for "Entrudo", but this refers to "Santitrudo".
'bolo de farinha e ovos, frito em óleo ou azeite, passado por calda de açúcar'. (=sonho)
'Tábua que forra o vão da ombreira das portas'.

comment.author: A. Andrade
comment.title: autor de um victor ficar baldo

w.comment: Probable interpretation: someone that has won a round in a game of cards (um victor?), and then becomes short of cards of a certain suit (baldo). To be understood as a metaphor.
The word 'veja' is repeated in the original, probably in order to attain the correct number of syllables in the verse.
There is a line break in this position.
'dê', pronounced with an open vowel due to rhyme with the following verse.
In the original we find: "[ Senhor Doutor )".
It must be 'açoites', in order to rhyme with 'noites'.
In the original, some letters are not clearly shown: eſt**a (letras feridas).
"Baile e cante" was shown originally some line above.
"Baile e cante" was shown originally some line above.
"Baile e cante" was shown originally some line above.
"Baile e cante" was shown originally some lines above.
"Baile e cante" was shown originally some line above.
"Baile e cante" was shown originally some lines above.
In the original text there is a line break at this point, but it does not correspond to the end of a verse.
In the original text there is a line break after this word, but it does not correspond to the end of a verse.
'espiga de milho descascada' (?) (Nueva revista de filología hispánica - año VI, n. I)
There was a semicolon (;) after this word.
A sort of medicine made from the fat from a lamb, cooked several times with a piece of bread, and refrigerated.
In the original, "Mostra o pé" was in the upper line.
"ária que acampanha um tipo de dança espanhola, grave e séria".
The saying "a más moros, más ganancia" refers to the attitude of overlooking risks by trusting that, the bigger they are, a bigger reward will be taken by overcoming them.
"Palmadas com chichelo (sapato velho)". Cf. Grande diccionario portuguez ou Thesouro da lingua portugueza, de Domingo Vieira.
A denominação "valente" nos nomes de personagens abaixo não está presente no original.
"Vaidoso, que se enfeita de maneira artificial." (Subst. 2 gen.)
In the original there is a dot at this point; however the syntex requires it to be excluded.
"íntegro, escorreito" (trigo usado como inteireza, integridade; cf. nota à edição CET-UL do Auto do Mouro Encantado, de António Prestes).
The indication of "Irmã" is lacking here and in the sentences below.
Reference to sirolico-tico, a game for children.
In a sequence of three "2.", we have reinterpreted the one in the middle as an "1.".
This must be a municipality close to Sintra or Cascais, and not "Muxagata", in the Douro region.
Lança de ferro, comprida e larga.
This mat refer to "Quinta dos Cardais", in the Oporto region.
'tratamento de animais doentes, por pessoas leigas'.
'pessoa que se estima muito, que se paparica'.
Name of districts in the city of Setúbal, Portugal. In he context, it may refer to drinking in all parties, or bars, in these places.
This sentence seems to represent the language of the drunk man.
This scene description appear in the above line, in the original text.
'festa de guarda' = festa ref. a dia santo.
Old form of 'querena' = "conserto feito em embarcação".
'gênero de crassuláceas que compreende ervas e subarbustos das regiões temperadas'.
Two unindenticied characters come into scene.
Probably this means to urinate on his hands, so as to take the vestiges of gunpowder.
'Deitar pólvora na escorva, orifício apropriado para tal'.
Mythological animal, said to cause death with his sight.
Ref. to the niece but also the name of a tree (pata-de-vaca).
In the original, this scene description appears two lines above.
